name: 11.26, 11.27, 11.28 "One More For the Road" Quiz | Television | 15 Questions

questions.text: When Don proposed, the first time, what did Rebecca say?
questions.correct: Oh Don, of course I won't.
options: Oh Don, I'll never marry you.
questions.explanation:
Oh Don, of course I won't.

	The second time she said "No." The third time she said "Never!"

questions.text: Who had cameos on the TV the guys were watching?
questions.explanation:
Kim Alexis and Mike Ditka.

	Kim Alexis was a supermodel. Mike Ditka was a football player.

questions.text: What did Diane get an award for writing?
questions.explanation:
The Heart Held Hostage.

	Her acceptance speech went on and on. She ended by saying, "You have to be taught to hate."

questions.text: What did Woody get mixed up?
questions.explanation:
A change and change.

	Fraiser explained that in the bar Woody made change, but out there as a councilman he'll make a change. Then Frasier said, "Change make change to make a change. Oh, just change it!"

questions.text: Who kept screaming when Diane entered the bar?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Carla saw Diane on TV and they convinced her she was hallucinating. She was afraid Diane was back for good, so Diane told her that they (her "husband" and her) were just visiting.

questions.text: How old did Rebecca say two year old Chelsea was?
questions.explanation:
1.

	She was telling the ages of her and Sam's children because she told Diane that her kids weren't that young. She had fooled Diane and said that she was a corporate attorney, she specialized in product liability cases.

His partner.

	His partner, Kevin, who he called "Muffin" was angry that Reed left Malibu without telling him. He thought Reed was out with Sam, when in reality he was pretending to be Diane's husband.

questions.text: How many years were Reed and Kevin together?
questions.explanation:
7.

	Apparently, Reed was not very faithful. Kevin said he put up with his "astronaut, anchorman, and all-star quarterback." Reed was begging for one last chance.

Paul.

	Paul said everything happened when he was not in the room. He then left when Don came down carrying Rebecca, and Reed and Kevin were fighting. He came back in, saw the looks on the other men's faces and said, "I missed something, didn't I?"

questions.text: What did Diane compare Rebecca's emotional equivalency to?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Toad's Wild Ride

	When Reed said the word "dawn" Rebecca thought of Don and started to cry again. Then she left with Don when he came up to get her.

questions.text: How long ago did Sam say Diane walked out on him?
questions.explanation:
6 years.

	Diane asked about his life. Sam said after walking out on him six years ago, she wasn't going to come in and just just talk about her "rich and full life".

questions.text: Why didn't Diane come back in six months like she promised?
questions.correct: Her novel never got published and she didn't want to return until she was successful.
options: She realized she really didn't love Sam so there was no reason to return.
She met Reed and fell in love with him.
Her book was published and she became too important to marry the likes of Sam.
questions.explanation:
Her novel never got published and she didn't want to return until she was successful.

	She said she trimmed a couple thousand pages from her novel and made it into a screenplay. But then she felt she was gone too long to return.

questions.text: Who got a job with the city of Boston?
questions.explanation:
Norm.

	Woody pulled some strings and got Norm a job. Also, Cliff got a promotion at the post office making it a great day at Cheers.

questions.text: Did Rebecca and Don get married?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	They went to the justice of peace before they could change their minds. Rebecca started crying when she talked to the gang at Cheers saying, "I married a plumber." Later on she said, "I shoot for Donald Trump and end up with Ed Norton." Sam said to her, "See you later, Trixie." Ed Norton was a sanitation worker on the show "The Honeymooners" and Trixie was his wife.

questions.text: This was the last episode of "Cheers". What was the last words spoken?
questions.explanation:
Sorry, we're closed.

	Sam realizes he's the luckiest man on earth after a conversation with Norm about love. It's touching at the end...Sam went over and fixed the picture of Geronimo, which was the picture that used to hang on Nicholas Colasanto's dressing room before he died. It was as if Sam was saying a final goodbye to Coach in this episode as well.
